results.definition: lacking special distinction, rank, or status; commonly encountered
around the middle of a scale of evaluation
approximating the statistical norm or average or expected value
examples: the average income in New England is below that of the nation
of average height for his age

results.definition: amount to or come to an average, without loss or gain
examples: The number of hours I work per work averages out to 40

results.definition: a statistic describing the location of a distribution
relating to or constituting the middle value of an ordered set of values (or the average of the middle two in a set with an even number of values)

examples: the caliber of the students has gone from mediocre to above average

results.definition: relating to or constituting the most frequent value in a distribution
an intermediate scale value regarded as normal or usual
examples: he is about average in height
the snowfall this month is below average

results.definition: (sports) the ratio of successful performances to opportunities
